class_notes:
(Same as AAS 261 1)
(This course surveys African American literature and print culture before the 20th century. Reading across genres--slave narratives, poetry, biography, speeches, and journalism--we will examine this literature in the contexts of Black freedom struggles and Western literary and cultural traditions. Authors will range from Frederick Douglass to F.E.W. Harper and Charles Chesnutt.)
course_description: An overview of African-American literature prior to 1900. Students will read and examine writings by major contributors to each period in the genres of fiction (short story and novel) essay, poetry, and narratives of enslavement. Students will write four five-page critical essays.
